story:
So, why fund a theatre show?

My name is Hayley Pace and I am the founder of this project and Sneaky Sneaky Productions, the company. I am a graduate of the Devised Theatre & Design program at York University. Concurrent with my education, I have worked (in some aspect of theatre, or another) internationally in cities such as Antwerp, Prague and Edinburgh. I have assisted renown theatre designers such as Peter McKinnon, Phillip Silver and most recently, Broadway and television actress, Tovah Feldshuh who is best known for her role as Golda in Golda's Balcony and as Deanna Monroe in The Walking Dead.

I realize most independent theatre does not speak to a large portion of my generation. Truthfully, is also not necessarily their first choice on the "things to do tonight" list...and understandably so due to the popularity of "home-comfort entertainment" -- the internet, movies, television, video games. In response to this observation, our company wants to create theatre that absolutely needs to be seen live by using the power of surprise: an experience the comfort of your home cannot give you. We primarily focus on creating unexpected musical events within a theatrical setting that make our audience feel part of a shared experience.

What We Need

We need $5,000 for this project. You will be contributing to the following project fundamentals: 

  • Venue rental (The Baltimore House, 43 King William Street, Hamilton, Ontario. Includes full sound and lighting fixtures, light control console, mixer, licensed and operational bar, SOCAN licensed, capacity: 80-100)
  • Sound equipment purchases/rentals (Pyle vintage-style microphone and swing stand, 1 monitor, 4 amplifers [vocal, electric piano, electric guitar & bass], 7 headset microphone wireless systems, 1 drum kit harness, 1 clarinet rental etc.)
  • A professional tuning of the in-house piano
  • Prop purchases (2 domestic fans, pack of confetti, earphones, 10 slices of fresh cheese pizza [for every show] and 10 different toppings etc.)
  • Printing costs (15 copies of the script, schedule, contract, full score/libretto, 50 posters, 120 postcards, 100 show programs etc.)
  • Costume purchases/rentals (13 jazz hats, white dress shirts, black pants, fabric for waist/neck scarves, various styles of suspenders, ornamented and custom design suit jacket for pianist, fox-onesie for singer etc.)
  • Transportation (van rental for load-in/load-out, car/GO Bus fare to and from Hamilton for festival events such as Art Crawl, Hamilton Fringe Company Launch etc.)
  • Website fees (iPage, Wordpress etc.)

The Perks

  • Two free tickets to the show
  • A bound, transposed copy of our pianist, Luc Gaylie's insanely complicated piano solo
  • An original love song written FOR YOU by Hayley Pace and Luc Gaylie. The song will be recorded by the band and emailed to you as a .mp3 file
  • A cover of your favourite song
  • A quartet singing right at your doorstep
  • If you're really nice, the full band will play right at your doorstep!

The Impact

The power of surprise removes us temporarily from everyday life and inspires us to believe the unexpected is possible. This is especially powerful when there is no division between the performer and the audience. In the midst of excitement and ecstasy, we watch a musician pour their heart into their music and we, as the spectator, relate with this passion and vulnerability.

We want to create something that is loud, energetic and accessible to a non-theatre going audience -- something impossible to feel from the comfort of the home. With your contribution, we are working towards making a shared music experience that is affordable and with respect to the limitations of budgeting for independent theatre.

Previous projects include YUFFA Fringe's Nudity, Free Beer, Good For Kids which premiered at the 2015 Edinburgh Festival Fringe raising nearly $800 with the help of a campaign. Because of your help, the show could tour to The Box Toronto and we played to a sold-out house, taking home the 2015 Audience Choice Award.

Risks & Challenges

We are mostly comprised of university students and/or recent graduates of music and theatre programs. Our experience in show-making and music making is limited professionally to our time of study. To combat this challenge, we are seeking mentorship from our professors who are well-versed in these fields to guide the development of the show. Future aspirations include bringing the show to an established theatre company incubation program in Toronto. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Come out and see us play! We are performing the show July 14th - 17th and the 21st - 24th, 7pm at the Baltimore House. Hamilton, Ontario. Advance tickets are online here: http://hamiltonfringe.ca/shows/teeny-tiny-music-show/

You can also catch us at Art Crawl on James Street North, Hamilton on July 8th and at the Waterdown Art & Music Streetfest in August. More updates to come!
story_txt:
So, why fund a theatre show? My name is Hayley Pace and I am the founder of this project and Sneaky Sneaky Productions, the company. I am a graduate of the Devised Theatre & Design program at York University. Concurrent with my education, I have worked (in some aspect of theatre, or another) internationally in cities such as Antwerp, Prague and Edinburgh. I have assisted renown theatre designers such as Peter McKinnon, Phillip Silver and most recently, Broadway and television actress, Tovah Feldshuh who is best known for her role as Golda in Golda's Balcony and as Deanna Monroe in The Walking Dead.
I realize most independent theatre does not speak to a large portion of my generation. Truthfully, is also not necessarily their first choice on the "things to do tonight" list...and understandably so due to the popularity of "home-comfort entertainment" -- the internet, movies, television, video games. In response to this observation, our company wants to create theatre that absolutely needs to be seen live by using the power of surprise: an experience the comfort of your home cannot give you. We primarily focus on creating unexpected musical events within a theatrical setting that make our audience feel part of a shared experience.   What We Need We need $5,000 for this project. Because of your help, the show could tour to The Box Toronto and we played to a sold-out house, taking home the 2015 Audience Choice Award.

Our experience in show-making and music making is limited professionally to our time of study. story:
COMMITTED CITIZEN

A New Play by Abbe Tanenbaum

Roberta, a politically active New Yorker in her 70's hires a personal organizer to help her tackle the clutter of her Chelsea apartment. While organizing mountains of untouched papers, they discover letters from Roberta's work in an underground abortion clinic in the 70's. Letters from from women all over the country desperate for abortions. Women asking for help.

The play strives to shatter preconceived notions and stereotypes of the kinds of women that seek out abortions. Join in the discussion as women from two different generations discuss feminism, abortion, and what is means to be of service to the world. 

We need YOUR help to make it possible. 

 

 

The World Premiere will take place at PACA in Erie, PA. 

Staring: Betsy Butoryak, Jess Pierce, Brit Soule, Jennifer Perry, Leslie Gordon Ford, and Amy Eisert Brotz.

Co–directed by Karen Schelinski and Mark Tanenbaum

Lighting by Dave Schroeder.

Performance Dates:

story:
Good day! We are Earnest & Wilde, a comedy musical duo who perform contemporary songs with a vintage spin.  We've been described as “Postmodern Jukebox with jokes.”

We have been offered the chance to present our first full-length show at the Adelaide Fringe in 2018. This is the world’s second-largest Arts Festival after the Edinburgh Fringe and a fantastic opportunity to showcase our work to a whole new audience and possibly climb the ladder of success (it has very slippery rungs).

The wonderful La Boheme is our venue where, in their gorgeous main cabaret space, we will present a hilariously unhistorical show where we guarantee audiences will learn nothing useful.  There will also likely be tea.

What We Have To Pay For

Travelling to Adelaide from Glasgow is pricey enough but once we get there, we have so many costs to cover!

  • Accommodation – we need a place to sleep.  Nothing fancy and we’re prepared to share with other artists if needed.
  • Venue Hire – this is one thing we can’t save on; the venue needs paid.
  • Fringe Registration – to be a part of the Adelaide Fringe, we have to pay a registration fee that ensures we get listed in the official Fringe Programme.  The Adelaide Fringe also provide a wealth of advice and support.
  • Visas – another necessity.  Australia offers a great short-term entertainment visa but it isn’t cheap.
  • Marketing Materials (flyers & posters) – got to promote ourselves once we’re there.  We’ve secured the talents of Martin Smith who is going to do all our design for free but the printing and distribution have unavoidable costs. We're also getting some free promotional photoshoots from RwP Photography.
  • APRA (Australian Performing Rights Association) – as we perform other people’s songs, those artistes have to be paid and APRA take care of this for a small fee.
  • Insurance and Australian Public Liability Insurance – because you have to plan for the things that you can’t plan for!

The Impact

We’re lucky enough to have a very good Producer who believes in us and is offering his services for no upfront fee.  Frodo Allan at Rhymes with Purple is taking care of all our administration and will be running our PR and marketing campaign.  He’s also going to make sure that we get seen by top bookers and agents who can offer us future opportunities to share our work with the world.

We'll also be eligible for a number of awards and we have high hopes that we'll come home with some accolades to our name!  The Adelaide Fringe is already much more welcoming to cabaret acts than other festivals and music cabaret does particularly well there.

Risks & Challenges

So, you’re probably asking, “what happens if you don’t hit your target?”  Good question.  Very astute of you to ask, you‘re obviously a person of integrity, clear thought, and charm...

Well, the simple answer is... We go anyway!  We’ll do everything on the cheap and very likely bankrupt ourselves but it’s too good an opportunity not to do it.  Plus, we’ve signed contracts so pulling out now would be very bad for our reputation.

We’ll sleep on floors in shared flats, we’ll eat instant noodles every day, we’ll spend the whole time there completely sober! We’re willing to make sacrifices here. But we'd rather not.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and we completely understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share this link on your Facebook and Twitter accounts.
  • Perhaps you can help us in non-financial ways?
    • Do you have skills or talents you could offer?
    • Maybe you have several thousand Air-Miles you're not going to use anytime soon?
    • You might even have some friends in Adelaide to whom you could recommend our show?

Any help you can offer will be hugely appreciated and we hope that you'll take a moment to assist.

story:
Hello everyone and Happy Holidays! 21/40 Productions is back and we are just about to begin rehearsals for our  first full length production, Dog Sees God: Confessions of a Teenage Blockhead.

 

At 21/40, our mission is to tell honest and accessible stories. We strive to give our audiences an intimate and unique experience every time they join us and we believe this script fits perfectly into that vision.

 

Dog Sees God is an “unauthorized parody” of the Peanuts. The kids are all grown up and hardly recognizable.  And of course, Charlie Brown - now CB - is at the center of it all.

 

The loss of a childhood friend forces our guy into an identity crisis .... Good Grief! … and nobody seems to care. His sister is too busy with drama club, his ex-girlfriend is in lock up, and his friends are too high to help. With nowhere else to turn, he pours his heart out to a piano player – one of the kids he normally bullies – and their friendship has the entire school on edge

This play has so many wonderful things for us to explore … bullying, loss, friendship, drug uses … and it’s all through the lense of these characters that we all thought we knew.

 

On top of a stellar story, we’ve assembled an incredible cast and booked a really neat and intimate venue for this show, but of course we still need to raise some funds to make this the best production possible. Anything raised will go towards costumes, props, renting set pieces, marketing and paying our actors for the time and effort they’ve dedicated to telling this story. If enough is raised, we would also use some of the funds raised to sponsor a few free performances, or  pay-what-you-can performances. We want to ensure that all members of our community, no matter their circumstances, have the opportunity to see our show.

 

There are so many fantastic projects you can donate to this Holiday Season, we would be beyond grateful if you would consider contributing to our campaign. 

 

Dog Sees God opens February 23rd at Pinwheel Arts & Movement Studio. For dates and ticket information, check out our website.  We’d love to see you there!

story:
Short Summary

Hey! We're Brooklyn Repertory Theater, a Bushwick based theater company. 
Brooklyn Repertory was created by friends who wanted to change the way race was being portrayed on stage. We believe in colorblind casting, multiracial teams, no stereotypes and most of all - an inclusive world. 
This is our third production of the season, and we've amped it up! We'll be tackling Chekhov's classic Three Sisters with a diverse cast and performing at the prestigious Fourth Street Theatre - the show will go up during the first week of February. 
We've cast actors from various ethnicities. Our team is made up of young Hispanic, African American, Caucasian, Jewish and Asian artists. We want to create opportunities and break racial divides. 
We're reaching out to ask for your help in making our dream theater happen. We're a small team of emerging artists working with lots of heart but limited resources. Your generosity will help us to pay our actors and crew, put on a great professional looking production and subsidize tickets for young people! 

What We Need & What You Get

Your donations will help us pay for cast and crew stipends, rehearsal spaces, build sets, costumes, props and subsidize tickets for young people!

As a thank you, we'll be doing social media shoutouts with our multiracial cast, access to our cast rehearsal workshops, masterclasses, complimentary front row tickets and producing credit. 


The Impact

Keep our new company growing and help us build our dream of a racially inclusive society and creating opportunities for actors of all ethnicities. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you love our ideas and would like to help out as a volunteer or an artist looking to get involved, we'd love to hear from you too! Just email us as brooklynrepertory@gmail.com


Cast & Team 

Directed by Victor Cervantes Jr
Starring: Tahirah Stanley, Anna Tempte, Elisabeth Ng, Mike Turner, Ilinca Tuvene, Alexander Lambie, Erick Betancourt, Roberto Sanabria, Ran Levy, Fabio Motta, Rony Herman, Stephen McFarlane, Renee Petrofes




Budget Breakdown

story:
GESTUS, un espacio de creación de espectáculos, talleres y formación de artistas  que busca transformar y aportar positivamente en todos aquellos que se involucran en los diferentes proyectos a través de herramientas como el clown, el humor, la creatividad y de diferentes lenguajes artísticos.

Desde hace más de 5 años Gestus viene convirtiéndose en un referente de formación y transformación tanto de personas, como de proyectos que pasan por nuestras manos.Herramientas como la actuación, el cuerpo, el clown, el humor y  la música nos han permitido ser cómplices y testigo de la transformación de más 3440 personas a través de talleres, 5320 espectadores y 5650 personas impactadas en trabajo social hasta hoy.

Hoy asumimos un nuevo reto de continuar transformando a través del arte con “Casi Don Quijote” y para ellos necesitamos de tu ayuda.

La experiencia de nuestra directora y fundadora Paloma Reyes de Sá  en los últimos años dirigiendo y liderando proyectos artísticos le ha permitido impactar en más de 74,200 espectadores con sus diferentes proyectos que suman a la experiencia de esta nueva obra.


CASI DON QUIJOTE

“Casi Don Quijote” es un espectáculo de humor dirigido por Paloma Reyes de Sá para toda la familia que se presentará de mayo a julio del 2016 en el Centro Cultural de la Católica. La obra busca hacer que el público descubra lo divertido que es la realización de un espectáculo teatral y todo el proceso que involucra una creación colectiva y el trabajo en equipo; generando una experiencia lúdica donde grandes y chicos descubrirán que el juego, la literatura y la diversión presentes en la obra, son factores que pueden vincularlos positivamente entre sí, dentro y fuera del espacio teatral y que combinados pueden convertirse en una experiencia muy divertida.


GESTUS is a place where performances are created as well as workshops and artistic formation. It constantly seeks to transform and contribute positively in all those who are involved in our projects using tools like the clown, humour, creativity and artistic languages.

For over 5 years Gestus has become a model of formations as well as transformation of both people, and projects that have passed through us.

Tools like acting, the human body, clown, humour, and music has allowed us to be accomplices and witnessed the transformation of over 3440 people through workshops, 5320 as spectators and 5650 people affected by the social work.

Now we assumed a new challenge to continue transforming through art, this time with ¨Casi Don Quijote¨ (Almost Don Quixote) and for that we need your help.

Our Director and Foundress Paloma Reyes de Sá, has been directing and leading artistic projects during the past years that have affected more than 74,200 spectators and now those performances are adding to the experience for this new play.


CASI DON QUIJOTE

“Casi Don Quijote” is a show of humour for the entire family directed by Paloma Reyes de Sá that will be presented from May to July of 2016 at the Centro Cultural de la Católica. This play seeks to make the audience discover the fun of making a theatre show and all the process that involve the collective creation and team work, generating a playful experience where adults and children will find out that games, literature and fun, elements that appear on the show, that all combine can become a very enjoyable experience

de Sá that will be presented from May to July of 2016 at the Centro Cultural de
la Católica. This play seeks to make the audience discover the fun of making a
theatre show and all the process that involve the collective creation and team
work, generating a playful experience where adults and children will find out
that games, literature and fun, elements that appear on the show, that all
combine can become a very enjoyable experience

story:
Short Summary

December 3rd - 6th, 2015 Associacao de Capoeira Mestre Bimba - California, USA will have it's second Capoeira Tournament/Batizado in Oakland, CALIFORNIA!

This is a great opportunity for our kids who have been committed and working hard for the past three years to express their feelings and emotions through this unique championship-graduation event. We need your kindness and generosity to make this beautiful event into a reality! This is why we are asking for your financial support.

ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE!

What is a Batizado?

A batizado is a Capoeira ceremony where new students are symbolically introduced to the world-wide Capoeira community and receive their first belt (corda). Other Capoeira Mestres, instructors and students are invited to the ceremony, where they joyfully welcome the new Capoeiristas (people that play Capoeira). As in many aspects of Capoeira, the batizado has its own symbolism and is a very special event. It is not a competition but rather a weekend-long event filled with community and activities where Capoeiristas share their knowledge and love of this beautiful art form.

Our Story

Helio Luiz has been a Bay Area resident since 2010, when he moved from Michigan. In the Capoeira world, Helio is known as Professor Sereno. He began his Capoeira training in 1992 with his uncle, and then trained in different schools in Salvador, Brazil. He also took dance classes with the respected Brazilian dance Masters Clyde Morgan, Master King and Master Paquito. In 1999, through a project for low-income families, Helio joined the Capoeira school A.C.M.B, directed by Mestre Bamba (which Helio still belongs to today). For the past six years Helio has taught Capoeira in Brazil and throughout the United States and Canada. For the past three years he has been teaching Capoeira for families of all social-economic levels at the Berkeley YMCA, Truve, Birdland Social Club, for at-risk kids in a program run by the city of San Francisco, at the Brazilian Center in Sacramento and in other locations throughout the Bay Area and California.

Jadson Souza moved to the Bay Area in 2010 when he started his local Capoeira practice by giving lessons on a playground of a nearby elementary school. He soon joined the team at Destiny Arts, a twenty-five year old nonprofit that teaches Bay Area youth violence-prevention through the arts. Since working with Destiny Arts, Jadson has taught in various elementary schools, dance and martial arts studios. Jadson’s most rewarding work has been teaching Capoeira and music to developmentally disabled adults at the Clausen House in Oakland. Jadson currently offers an adult Capoeira program, a children’s program in Alameda, and is part of the city of San Pablo’s COPT (Childhood Obesity Prevention Task Force). Jadson has introduced Capoeira to more than fifty kids from San Pablo, California (in one year alone).  A city that has the third highest rate of obesity in California.

Instructor Alice (Piu-Piu)

Though originally from the Bay Area, Alice Riegert (Piu Piu) first laid eyes on capoeira at the Associacao de Capoeira Mestre Bimba in Salvador, Brazil. While on summer vacation in 2005, she went to a performance at the school and was so awe-struck by the martial art that she immediately started taking capoeira classes back in the US. She trained under Mestre Mariano of Capoeira Batuque in her university town of Santa Barbara and spent the summers training with Mestre Acordeon and Mestra Suelly at UCA in Berkeley. In 2008 she studied abroad in Brazil and came full circle, joining the Associacao the following year.

Goal is to raise $8000

1. Master Bamba ticket and his workshop fees.

He's the current Capoeira Master in charge of the First Capoeira Regional School of Brazil that was created by the legendary Master Bimba.

http://www.capoeiramestrebimba.com.br

2. Contra-Mestre Reni ticket and his workshop fees.

http://capoeiraacademy.ca/

3. Contra-Mestre Cabaca and his workshop fees.

4. Julio & Julia Remelexo and workshop fees.

5. Wag Groove and workshop fees.

6. Thais Harris, Nutritionist Consultant, Co-Founder, Holistic Nutrition Consultant at Nourish Together, and Nutrition Education Program Manager for Cares Community Project

7. Space Rental

8. Insurance for the event

9. CPR Nurse trainer

10. Food, Transportation, Hotel (visitants)

11. Instruments, and medals

These professionals will be sharing their international and local life skills by teaching workshops and sharing historical facts and talents with our kids and adults. Adding to the cultural enriching of all those who will attend the event. 

What is Capoeira?

Capoeira is a African Brazilian dance and martial art. The word Capoeira (pronounced KAP-oooo-ERA) can be defined as two separate things in Portuguese. The word "capoeira" refers to a small, remote clearing in a field of grass or sugarcane, or it can also mean a style of ritualistic, playful dance that emerged in Brazilian culture during slavery. These two things are connected: the clearing in the field was frequently a place where Capoeiristas practiced their dance, which needed to be held in secret. 

    Capoeira's Impact

    Capoeira is an incredible and unique African-Brazilian Art Form that not only strengthens and units the community, but also builds strong children, morally, mentally, and physically. For instance, when playing Capoeira, children make their own decisions - simple and complexes ones. It allows them to develop empathy, and care for one another, and it also promotes healthy competitive instincts that are necessary in a capitalist society. The main goal as a teacher, is to encourage and instill confidence into every student by way of this unique dance and martial art.

      Thank you for your support!

      CapoeiraOaktown.com

story:
A year and a half ago I started developing this script. Loads of hard work and hours upon hours of musical collaboration have gone into this project to make it the delightful, humorous hybrid it is today. A very talented cast will perform the world-premiere show at the New Orleans Faux/Real Festival (Fringe) in November at the Old Marquer Theatre (Marigny/Bywater neighborhood) . I am beyond excited to be working in collaboration with See 'Em On Stage: A Production Company and Director Christopher Bentivegna. It is my dream to lift this project off of the ground and finally see it on the stage. 

If you're a fan of the Terminator movies, of musicals, or both... this show promises to tickle your fancy with original songs and satirical fun. A through-line of love and family amongst futuristic machine warfare will have you viewing Sarah Conor, John Connor, Kyle Reese, and T (the Terminator) in a new light, as they navigate their way through the 80s and 90s.

Contributions to this campaign will go toward the actual production, from festival fees to props and costume.

story:
Jeanne d´Arc Casas is a puerto rican dancer and choreographer working on Hij@as de La Bernarda. This work is a movement investigation between Theatre, contemporary dance and Flamenco. Serves as inspiration the work by the renowned dance master Gilda Navarra. Forty years ago, Navarra choreographed a piece called Ocho Mujeres for her dance troupe Taller de Histriones. This work is also inspired by La casa de Bernarda Alba de Federico García Lorca who also served as inspiration for Navarra's dance piece Ocho Mujeres. 

Jeanne d’Arc Casas, bailarina y coreógrafa es la creadora Hij@s de La Bernarda. Un trabajo que explora la danza contemporánea y el flamenco. Sirve de inspiración el mimodrama Ocho mujeres, que concibió Gilda Navarra con el Taller de Histriones hace cuarenta años. El trabajo de laboratorio también tomará en cuenta el clásico español: La casa de Bernarda Alba de Federico García Lorca que fue el punto de partida para la pieza Ocho Mujeres.


Cast/ Reparto:

Choreography/ Coreografía: Jeanne d'Arc Casas & dancers/ bailarines

Concept and direction/ Dirección escénica y concepto: Rosa Luisa Márquez

Dancers/ Bailarines: Jesús 'Pito' Miranda, Cristina Lugo, María Alejandra Castillo, Beatriz Irizarry, Marili Pizarro, Kianí del Valle

Music/ Música: Rafael Martínez, Pilli Aponte, Enrique Chávez

Stage design and lights/ Escenografía y luces: Juan Fernando Morales

Set design consultor/ Asesor de diseño: Antonio Martorell

General Assistant/ Asistente general: Marili Pizarro

Producers/ Producción: Proyecto de Residencias Artísticas, Centro de Bellas Artes, Miguel Villafañe

story:
Short Summary

We are excited to combine Mary Nora’s theatrical prowess with Brandon’s darkly comedic writing to bring to life Entertainment Buffet's first theater production. With your contribution you can help this project become a reality that you can come see live AT STAGE 773 IN DOWNTOWN CHICAGO!

What We Need & What You Get

The budget of $4,000 is the smallest amount we can ask for that will give us everything we need in order to make this play the best it can be. A large portion of the budget will go towards renting a quality stage that will allow audiences comfortable seating. Other costs will include:

  • Renting Rehearsal Space
  • Props and Set Decoration
  • Programs to Include Credit to You 
  • Paying our Actors and Crew

The Impact

A percentage of our ticket sales after production will be donated to charities geared towards mental illness and suicide prevention hotlines.

This play is a dark comedy that dabbles with dramatic subjects that are often very stigmatized such as therapy, suicide and mental illness. We hope to help break down that stigma so that we can open the conversation for these more and will not be considered taboo to openly discuss.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has it within their budget to donate but we appreciate every penny that you are willing to support us with. If you cannot swing it, then PLEASE share this page via social media or email to help get the word out to friends, family, coworkers or your weird neighbor!

story:
A little more about and the project...

My name is Joe Janes. I'm a Chicago playwright who teaches at Columbia College Chicago and at The Second City. I have been working with an amazing director and team of actors to bring Our Christian Nation to the stage. We are currently in the middle of a successful run at The Conservatory in Chicago. We love the show so much, we want to share it with the world. It's, uh, shall we say, an unusual time we live in. Now more than ever, satire has been an effective weapon at waking people up and getting under some other's tremendously thin skin. Our play takes a look at what our country would look like if the extreme Christian right got everything they wanted. Everything. And it's a comedy! Please help us cover our expenses. We believe our message (warning?) is an important one.

story:
Short Summary

Katherine Cartusciello, Nick Cartusciello, and Coya Pruden have teamed up to bring this heartwarming short tale to the New Works Play Series theater festival in NYC. 

Katherine, who graduated from Columbia University in 2016, majored in music composition in order to expand on her sound design background. 

Coya Pruden, who graduated from Columbia University in 2017, danced, acted, and cirque'd around professionally for 10 years before returning to school to study politics, human rights, and Slavic studies.

Nick Cartusciello, who graduated from Rutgers University, is an actor, dancer, singer, mime, director, and teacher of theater to children all around the world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The Latchkey Kid is an interdisciplinary musical, with a heavy focus on dance and movement. Since we will depend on dancers to depict the tale (while the Narrator describes their actions and eggs them on), we need rehearsal space with proper floors and a decent amount of space in which to move around.

Our cast is small (8 performers, total!) which means that our actors and dancers will be playing multiple roles in rapid succession. To execute this without confusion, we will rely on costumes and props to help differentiate between the roles. 

Finally, we believe in the power of theater and imagination, and the good they can contribute to the world. We want to pay homage to that.  We not only want to produce a good quality show that appeals to the emotions of our audiences, but be ethical by offering a small stipend to our non-equity talent.

Our funds will go, first and foremost, to rehearsal space. Once we have that squared away, we will use our funds to provide our performers with costumes and props. Any remaining funds will go towards the stipends we offer to our performers and crew. 

In return, we will send you downloadable versions of the artwork, as well as the full soundtrack!

The Impact

The Latchkey Kid is an equal-opportunity show. We, the creative team, strongly believe that art is a universal language, and therefore should be all-inclusive, and a celebration of the diversity that exists in this world.  The Latchkey Kid aims to use art as a tool to bring people together, and allow them to share the joys of theater, dance, and music, through the wonders of a child's imagination. 

Risks & Challenges

We want The Latchkey Kid to be a performance enjoyed by all, and in order to do so we require funds to help ease the financial burden involved. Putting on a show in New York City is difficult as it is, and we, the creative team, are recent graduates and are therefore just starting out. That is why we humbly ask for any help you can provide, as it is crucial to our success. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, no worries! (trust us, we get it) Here are some other ways you can help:

 

Like and Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/latchkeykidmusical/

 

Share our Flyer and spread the word! 

 

Share the Flyer for Manhattan Repertory Theater's New Works Play Series!

 

Come see the show on September 29th and 30th, at 6:30 pm! Tickets are available, Reserve Your Tickets ASAP!

story:
Reno's newest modern dance company presents Synopsis of This.!

Hi! My name is Keely Cobb and I am the founder and artistic director of Around the Stage | Modern Dance Company. I am a graduate from the University of Nevada, Reno with a B.A in theater and a minor in dance. After graduation I began self-producing my own evening length works including The Showbiz Cabaret and Relations in Reno, NV. I am so excited to now be producing Synopsis of This. while presenting Reno's newest modern dance company, Around the Stage.

Here's the Synopsis: 

Synopsis of This. is a modern dance show mixed with some traditional acting techniques that explores the struggle of dependence versus independence found in our everyday lives. The word “synopsis” is added to the title because it references a general survey or summary of something. Within this work, the goal is to create a summary of events, objects, emotions, instances and connections that the audience can themselves relate to as being dependent on or as a reference of independence they have or once had in their own lives. It’s a show that breaks this fourth wall between audience and performer and allows a conversation to happen between them. This work contains multiple story lines told through a series of vignettes, or short scenes, that are at times quirky and silly and other times vulnerable and raw. The dancers have worked together to share their own stories of dependence and independence, through dressing yourself for the first time, needing that first cup of coffee in the morning, moving out, getting your first real job and asking that question of: “who am I in this relationship?” This is a show of failure, achievement, learning and growth and simply put, it’s the synopsis of life.

What We Need & What You Get

I'll keep it simple: The donations made through this campaign go towards paying our wonderfully talented dancers and crew for all the hard work they have put into this production. Our goal is to reach $2,400 to pay everyone at a professional rate. Any amount donated greatly helps in reaching our goal and everything goes towards paying those who have helped get this show on its feet!

  • We need 2,400 dollars. ((6 dancers x $100/show x 3 shows = 1,800) + (2 Techies x $100/show x 3 shows = 600)) = $2,400
  • If you donate, you get stuff too!! There are special perks for special donations!! Check out our perks tab! (Free tickets, a signed poster, personalized thank you cards, company repertory class, etc.) 
  • If we don't reach our goal of $2,400, don't worry, the money will be disbursed evenly to the cast and crew! 

  • We are a new company and any support from the community allows us to grow and continue putting on these productions and giving opportunities to talented local dancers and crew members! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We also ask that you share our campaign on Facebook,  tweet it and email it out using the links in the upper right corner.  You can also follow our campaign and stay updated with all the events we'll have coming up, show dates and progress on the campaign. We'd like to thank everyone for checking out our campaign and we greatly appreciate any and every bit of support in getting this production up and going!

I am a graduate from the University of Nevada, Reno with a B.A in theater and a minor in dance. After graduation I began self-producing my own evening length works including The Showbiz Cabaret and Relations in Reno, NV. I am so excited to now be producing Synopsis of This. while presenting Reno's newest modern dance company, Around the Stage.

Here's the Synopsis: 
Synopsis of This. is a modern dance show mixed with some traditional acting techniques that explores the struggle of dependence versus independence found in our everyday lives. The word “synopsis” is added to the title because it references a general survey or summary of something. Within this work, the goal is to create a summary of events, objects, emotions, instances and connections that the audience can themselves relate to as being dependent on or as a reference of independence they have or once had in their own lives. It’s a show that breaks this fourth wall between audience and performer and allows a conversation to happen between them. This work contains multiple story lines told through a series of vignettes, or short scenes, that are at times quirky and silly and other times vulnerable and raw. The dancers have worked together to share their own stories of dependence and independence, through dressing yourself for the first time, needing that first cup of coffee in the morning, moving out, getting your first real job and asking that question of: “who am I in this relationship?” This is a show of failure, achievement, learning and growth and simply put, it’s the synopsis of life.


What We Need & What You Get
I'll keep it simple: The donations made through this campaign go towards paying our wonderfully talented dancers and crew for all the hard work they have put into this production. Our goal is to reach $2,400 to pay everyone at a professional rate. Any amount donated greatly helps in reaching our goal and everything goes towards paying those who have helped get this show on its feet!

We need 2,400 dollars. ((6 dancers x $100/show x 3 shows = 1,800) + (2 Techies x $100/show x 3 shows = 600)) = $2,400
If you donate, you get stuff too!! There are special perks for special donations!! Check out our perks tab! (Free tickets, a signed poster, personalized thank you cards, company repertory class, etc.) 
If we don't reach our goal of $2,400, don't worry, the money will be disbursed evenly to the cast and crew! 


We are a new company and any support from the community allows us to grow and continue putting on these productions and giving opportunities to talented local dancers and crew members! 
Other Ways You Can Help
We also ask that you share our campaign on Facebook,  tweet it and email it out using the links in the upper right corner.  You can also follow our campaign and stay updated with all the events we'll have coming up, show dates and progress on the campaign. We'd like to thank everyone for checking out our campaign and we greatly appreciate any and every bit of support in getting this production up and going!

story:
The Fool's Lear

A political leader with cognitive impairment; a dysfunctional family with political power; conflict over care for an aging parent -- today's headlines, and some of the situations highlighted in The Fool's Lear  -- William Shakespeare's King Lear, from the Fool's perspective.

The Fool's Lear is an Oldest Boys Production in association with Accidental Repertory Theater, John Strasberg, Artistic Director. In this production we bring together the "realistic school" of acting with Shakespeare. Acting in the realistic school is real life that happens in the context of a play. To achieve that with Shakespeare we maintain respect for the 400-year old language in its historical context while we look for contemporary resonance, as well. In short, we "make sense" of the language in a modern context.

Your contribution will help us bring the techniques and insights of the realistic school to bear on Shakespeare, as we revisit a venerable classic "from the inside out," and experience it from the point of view of a character who in the original is a keen observer, but most often at the side commenting.

Our cast includes Elizabeth Bell, Sean Demers, Stephen Dym, George Enders, Judy Krause, Robert McKay, Mark Peters, Valerie Redd, Mike Roche, Henry Shikongo, Perri Yaniv, and Katie Zaffrann.

Producers have applied to present The Fool's Lear under the AEA Showcase Code.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will help pay for:

  • Artist fees.
  • Space rental, for rehearsal and performance.
  •  Graphics and media.

In return, you could receive perks including:

  • Your name in the program.
  • A program autographed by the cast and crew.
  • Special invitation to the dress rehearsal.
  • All of the above, plus associate producer credit.

Contributions are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.

The Impact

With few exceptions, when one thinks of acting Shakespeare, one thinks of the precision and control of British actors. When one thinks of American acting, at least during the heyday of the Actors Studio, one thinks of gritty reality. With The Fool's Lear we are embarking on a journey to bring together the life in the context of the play, that is the hallmark of the realistic school, with the physical and vocal demands of Shakespeare. And the audience will see the play from the perspective of the Fool -- a character with a unique and privileged insight into the court, the family, the associates, and the person of King Lear.

Risks & Challenges

Producing in the Off-off Broadway setting is always challenging. Our production will compete with many others for the attention of the theater-going public. With the short rehearsal period and limited number of productions there's a risk that the production  will be unfinished, even in the closing performances.
 
In the face of these risks and challenges we have our commitment to process. And we agree with the poet W.H. Auden that creating a work of art is itself a political act -- political not in a partisan sense, but in the sense of representing a community.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? You can still help by spreading the word among your friends and associates, particularly through social media. 
 
You can use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word.
***
The Fool's Lear is being produced, in part, through Kori Rushton and IRT's Residency Season. (irttheater.org).

story:
So good to have lots of celebrities starting to back our campaign.


Help to fund an Investor Showcase of Like Me The Social Media Musical

The lovable, bearded and undeniably good-looking writers that brought you Jest End!, Naughty Pour Homme and Scary Musical are going bigger and better than ever before with a New York Investor Showcase of Like Me – The Social Media Musical


Like Me - The Social Media Musical

I like, therefore I am...

A twist on the romantic comedy in which four young adults navigate the social media minefield, looking for each other, for love, for validation and ultimately, for themselves – in amongst a cyber world populated by thousands of ‘followers’ and ‘friends’. Haunted by a lack of self-confidence and self-respect, Emma, Ashley, Luke and Charlie face physical, emotional and psychological challenges, leading them to question their very identity. Are they hiding behind their online profiles , or is there conviction in their tweets, pins, selfies, posts and status updates? Like the rest of the population, they’re digitally aware, armed with Wi-Fi enabled devices and online.

Let the tagging begin...

Funny, touching and timely, Like Me explores how reliant we’ve all become on social media and how we live our digital lives often in stark contrast to our real world personae.


Why this show? Why now?

Like Me is a four-hand, full-book musical that tackles the topic of social media head on. A timely theme; social media is altering how we communicate as human beings, how we present and promote ourselves online and how we communicate with others – brands now enter into online conversations with their customers, friends organize meet-ups and then post the photo evidence of those reunions through digital channels. Family members choose to communicate with each other via social media platforms, rather than phone or even in lieu of real-world meetings – so much of what was once done in private, face-to-face conversations, is now publicly posted on platforms such as Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and Pinterest.

Social media also influences, and is sometimes responsible for, creating relationships – how we meet our partners, how we interact and how we grow closer to others, sometimes having never met in real life… The rise and rise, and ultimately the influence, of social media on all our lives is profound, exciting and at the same time frightening.

Like Me – The Social Media Musical is the first musical to explore this worldwide phenomenon.


Production History

Like Me was first conceived as a song cycle and was work-shopped at the Dominion Theatre, London with a performance at the Arts Theatre, Leicester Square in November 2013. In January 2014 Garry Lake presented the song cycle at the Duplex, New York for a 3-night run and in February 2014 the song cycle was performed at the CMO Club at the Innovation and Inspiration Summit, Conrad Hilton, New York.

In 2014 Jon Smith joined Garry Lake as book writer and the full-book musical was work-shopped and performed at the Courtyard Theatre, London on October 3rd 2014.

Following the Courtyard Theatre showcase, Jon and Garry developed a new draft of the book and lyrics and showcased the revised full-book musical at Waterloo East Theatre on April 11th, 2015.

To date we’ve self-funded script development workshops and showcase performances of Like Me in both London and New York, we've paid for what we could, when we could, and called in a tremendous amount of favours and leveraged a lot of good will from Cast, Creatives, Crew and Musicians who've given us time, input and advice because of their love of this show. Now the work is complete, and ready for it's global premiere: we're here to raise the funds to mount an official Investor Showcase of the work in New York.


Our Promise

We know. It’s all about trust. You've backed a crowd-funded project before and that was the last you heard of it. So how do you know backing this project will actually lead to a finished product?

  • We have always made the most of our resources and have managed to self-fund and produce workshop performances in London’s West End and off-Broadway, New York. We’ve been creating quality musical theatre for ten years. We are going to do what we do best, on a bigger scale.
  • We have the infrastructure, knowledge, network and passion to mount an Investor Showcase to the very best of our abilities; the funds we are raising are for production and production quality. That means ALL of the funds will end up on the stage, and driving Investors to that stage, which is exactly where you want them.
  • The Like Me Creative Team is uniquely qualified to produce this show. Over the course of the last decade we have written and starred in West End productions and have a background in social media, online marketing and communications.
  • We promise to treat our Funders as valued partners – we will keep you constantly updated with progress, casting and creative decisions through our exclusive ‘Backers’ e-Newsletter, for all backers contributing at over £10.

What happens to the money?

Like Me has built up a strong following and with the help of an army of talented creatives, cast and musicians we are ready to make this next big step, but we need your help to make it as big as we possibly can! Funds from Indiegogo will be used for:

  • Cast, Creative Team and Crew: we will be casting talent from all across the country and recruiting some great people for behind the curtain as well.  The more money we raise, the bigger the Investor Showcase becomes and the more talent we can attract.
  • Stage/Set Design: With more money we can add value to the production with an exciting, innovative and digital stage design to enhance the stage experience.
  • Investor Development: With so much quality on the stage we want to let potential show Investors know about it! We will be engaging Investors via social media to build awareness

Here's a breakdown of the budget:

Production Costs – $23,610

 3-week rehearsal period & 1 Investors' Showcase

Professional EPK

(Cast, Creatives, Band, Support Staff)

Marketing - $1,425

(Paid Social, Search Engine Marketing, Posters, Hospitality, Press & PR)

Venue / Equipment - $4,725

(Rehearsal Venue/Showcase Venue/Sound/Lighting Equipment Hire)

Contingency @8% - $2,380

(Bank fees, Indiegogo fees, PayPal fees and changes to supplier quotes between now and invoicing)

------------------------------------------------

Total Budget:          $32,140

Total Expenditure:  $32,140

------------------------------------------------


What, Where, When?

What:
New York Investor Showcase of Like Me - The Social Media Musical

Where:

Rehearsal Venue/Possible Performance Venue:
Shetler Studios & Theatres

Address: 244 W 54th St #12, New York, NY 10019, United States


Potential Performance Venue:
54 Below
254 W 54th St, New York,
NY 10019, United States

When:
Auditions:  May / June , 2015
Rehearsals: June / July , 2015
Investor Showcase: July, 2015


Who are you?


Garry Lake - Music & Lyrics


Garry Lake trained at the Royal Welsh College of Music & Drama. West End Theatre credits include: TwoFace in Batman (O2 Arena. Warner Bros, NGM), Pop in We Will Rock You (Dominion Theatre), Frank Jnr/DJ Monty in Saturday Night Fever (Apollo Victoria). Touring & Rep Theatre credits include: Archibald Proops in Jekyl & Hyde (UK Tour),  Floyd in Grapes of Wrath (Clwyd  Theatr Cymru), Dunston in Silas Marner (Clwyd Theatr Cymru), Player in Rosencrantz & Guildenstern are Dead (Clwyd Theatr Cymru), Dame Sarah in Dick Whittington (The New Wolsey). Television credits include: Vic in Torchwood (BBC Wales). Radio credits include: Narrator in Playing Stalin's Tune (BBC Radio 4), Carlton Hobbs Team 2001.

As well as a working actor, Garry is an accomplished songwriter/producer. He is the creator/writer/producer of the hit West End comedy show Jest End, which celebrates its 6th anniversary this year. Garry has had recent and continued success with the song (Let Go) that he wrote and released under his own independent record label (Flour Records), with Samantha Barks, who recently portrayed the role of Eponine opposite Hugh Jackman and Russel Crowe in the film adaptation of Les Miserables.

Alongside the above, Garry has a photography business in London for which he is art director/stylist and photographer for fashion houses/commercial clients with theatrical & portrait work. 
www.garrylakephotography.com
www.garrylakephotography.tumblr.com
Instagram - @garrylakephotog


Jon Smith – Book/Libretto


Jon Smith is an internationally published, best-selling author of twelve books including The Bloke's Guide to Pregnancy (Hay House) and Be #1 on Google (McGraw-Hill). Writer of three musicals – The Count of Monte Cristo which debuted at the Birmingham Hippodrome in 2005. Scary Musical which enjoyed two sell out runs at the Belvoir (2010) and Waterfront Theatre, (2011) Belfast and Naughty Pour Homme, which was performed as part of the Script Accelerator program at the Park Theatre, London (2014).

Jon began his career as part of the launch team of Amazon.com in Europe and has worked in the digital marketing industry for 16 years. He wrote the first book to be published about Twitter in the UK entitled Dominate your market with Twitter (Infinite Ideas). He’s into social media and social networking in a big way.

Jon has been writing professionally for a decade. Awarded a MA in Screenwriting from Bournemouth University, Jon is currently developing a slate of feature films, TV dramas, sitcoms and musical theatre formats under the brand Balkon Films.

Website: www.jonsmith.net

Website: www.balkonfilms.com

LinkedIn: http://uk.linkedin.com/in/jonsmithlinkedin


James Doughty – Musical Director & Musical Arrangements

James Doughty has served as pianist, conductor and arranger for shows including: Saturday Night Fever, John & Jen, Rent (Winner BroadwayWorld.com "Best Musical Direction - Fringe" 2013, The Shakespeare Revue, The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee and Children of Eden. As an arranger, James was commissioned to create new arrangements for Unsung Songs' concerts dedicated to Divas and Andrew Lloyd Webber.

Rebecca Howell – Choreographer

American Psycho (Almeida) Falstaff (Royal Opera House); Jest End (Players Theatre); Blockbuster (Workshop). Viva Forever (Piccadilly Theatre); My Fair Lady (St Petersburg / Théâtre du Châtelet) We Will Rock You; Billy Elliot (West End); La Cage Aux Folles; A Little Night Music; Little Shop of Horrors (Menier Chocolate Factory / West End); Aspects of Love (Menier Chocolate Factory); Bad Girls (Garrick Theatre).

Gary Bowman – Lighting Designer


Liar Liar, 1001 Nights (Unicorn Theatre); Feathers in the Snow, The Only True History of Lizzie Finn (Southwark Playhouse); Life for Beginners (Theatre503); Gotcha, Mary Rose, Art of Concealment (Riverside Studios); Jest End (Jermyn Street Theatre); Miss Julie (Attic Theatre, Stratford Upon-Avon); Angel, The Muse (Pleasance Theatre) and Ordinary Lads

Gareth Tucker – Sound Designer

Urinetown (St James Theatre and West End transfer), Spamalot (Playhouse Theatre,) Singin’ in the Rain (Palace Theatre,) Love Story (Duchess Theatre)



Other Ways You Can Help

We understand better than most that cash is not always on hand. Even if you can't contribute financially, it doesn't mean you can't help:

Whether you're able to contribute financially or not, you can still get involved by spreading the word!


On the web: http://www.likememusical.com

Social media users can promote: #likememusical

Instagram: likememusical

Twitter - Follow:  @likeme_me | @sanseng | @garrylakemusic

Facebook users can keep up to date at http://www.facebook.com/likememusical

Remember, it all starts with a share... and what better way to promote a musical about social media, than through social media!

If the Investor Showcase is the success we believe it will be, then we'll be seeing you all in at the world premiere of Like Me very soon...


Sincerely,

Jon & Garry
xx

Theatre); Feathers in the Snow, The Only
True History of Lizzie Finn (Southwark Playhouse); Life for Beginners (Theatre503); Gotcha, Mary Rose, Art of Concealment
(Riverside Studios); Jest End
(Jermyn Street Theatre); Miss Julie
(Attic Theatre, Stratford Upon-Avon); Angel,
The Muse (Pleasance Theatre) and
Ordinary Lads
Gareth
Tucker – Sound Designer




Urinetown
(St James Theatre and West End transfer), Spamalot
(Playhouse Theatre,) Singin’ in the Rain
(Palace Theatre,) Love Story
(Duchess Theatre)


 
  

Other Ways You Can Help We understand better than most that cash is not always on hand. Even if you can't contribute financially, it doesn't mean you can't help:
Whether you're able to contribute financially or not, you can still get involved by spreading the word!
On the web: http://www.likememusical.com
Social media users can promote: #likememusical
Instagram: likememusical
Twitter - Follow:  @likeme_me | @sanseng | @garrylakemusic
Facebook users can keep up to date at http://www.facebook.com/likememusical
Remember, it all starts with a share... and what better way to promote a musical about social media, than through social media!
If the Investor Showcase is the success we believe it will be, then we'll be seeing you all in at the world premiere of Like Me very soon...
Sincerely,Jon & Garryxx

story:
Qui est Donya? Who is Donya?

(English will follow)

 

Allo!

Je suis Donya et je pratique la danse orientale depuis déjà 14 ans. Je danse depuis que je suis toute petite et je compte bien encore danser quand je serai toute vieille!

Quand je danse, rien d'autre ne compte que de vivre l'émotion et de la faire vivre à mon public. En arabe, Donya veut dire « monde ». La danse, c'est toute ma vie : mon monde tourne autour de cet art millénaire. J'ai mon style propre, des tonnes de connaissances et surtout, l’immense passion de partager ce que je sais!

Je rêve d'une carrière internationale et pour y arriver, je dois me faire connaître. J'ai déjà commencé sur la côte est des États-Unis en remportant la deuxième place ainsi que le choix du public au Delaware à l’occasion de l’événement Jewels of the Orient. J’ai aussi remporté la deuxième place au East Coast Classic. Pour poursuivre sur cette lancée, j’ai l'intention de participer à plusieurs compétitions internationales dans la prochaine année, notamment en Orégon, en Floride et en France.

Une carrière internationale, ça signifie d’enseigner dans des événements à l’extérieur du Québec, de danser lors des galas, d’être juge lors des compétitions et peut-être même de produire un CD et un DVD!


*English*

Hello!

My name is Donya. I am from Quebec, Canada, and I have bellydanced for 14 years. I have danced all my life and I hope I will do so as long as I can!

When I dance, nothing counts more than to live emotions and make my audience feel it too. Donya means "world" in Arabic and I chose this name because bellydance is my life!

I have my own style and a lot of knowledge I would like to share with the bellydance community around the world! If you read this it is probably because you know me from Delaware where I won the second place and people choice or in Virginia for the second place too!  But before, I won a few competitions in Quebec too. My goal is to compete in Oregon, Florida and France next year (and maybe more!)

All of you have the possibility to see me dancing again in your great area by contributing to this project!


Comment tu peux m'aider? How you can Help?


Pour mener à bien mon projet cette année, j'ai besoin d'environ 5000$.

Chaque compétition coûte environ 1000$. Cela inclut les frais de transport, dont le billet d'avion, ainsi que l’hôtel, la nourriture et bien sûr l'inscription à la compétition et à l'événement.

Voici les compétitions auxquelles j’aimerais participer, grâce à votre aide, cette année (mais peut-être y en aura-t-il davantage si vous osez me soutenir!) :

-  Belly Dancer USA en Orégon en juin (1000$)

-  Miami Bellydance Convention en août (1000$)

-  Jawhara Oriental Festival en France en février 2016 (1500$)

Mais ce n’est pas tout, il y a aussi le costume! Eh oui! Pour être remarquée, le glamour est de mise! Un costume digne d'une professionnelle coûte au minimum 500$ et pour en avoir un sur mesure qui est vraiment spécial et qui reflète ma personnalité, je devrai débourser près de 1000$. Sans oublier les petits à-côtés : maquillage, coiffure, manucure, etc.

De plus, pour constamment perfectionner ma technique, je suis un coaching privé rigoureux avec une professeure et danseuse de renommée internationale qui croit fermement en mon potentiel, ce qui me coûte aussi des sous tous les mois.

Je t'offre ici la possibilité de participer à mon rêve de plusieurs façons : en te procurant des billets pour mon spectacle, en prenant une série de cours privés ou, pourquoi pas, en prenant un massage! Parce que pour les gens de la région de Québec, c'est possible!


*English*

Each competition costs around 1000$ for me and never forget the costumes and the details around the outfit which are very important in our dance!

I plan to do at least 3 competitions this year, plus buy at least one great handmade costume that reflects my personality on stage.

I do have a wonderfull coach who believes in my potential and helps me develop it.

You can hepl in different ways. For instance you may get a calendar or private classes in exchange of your help.


Tu encouragerais certainement un espoir olympique, alors pourquoi ne pas encourager une artiste en danse orientale à réaliser son rêve? 

You would help an Olympic hopeful, so why not help a bellydance artist?


Non, je ne saute pas d'un plongeon de 10 mètres et je ne peux pas courir un 100 mètres en 10 secondes, mais je défierais n'importe quel athlète à un combat de mouvements d'abdominaux! ;)

Chaque fois que je danse, j'offre joie et émerveillement à mon public. Chaque fois que j'enseigne, je me donne corps et âme pour que mes élèves évoluent tout en s'amusant.

Je suis un pari sûr et je suis déterminée à atteindre mon but!

*English*

No, I don't jump from 10 meters high in a pool and I cannot run a 100 meters in 10 seconds, but I challenge any of these athletes to move their abdominal muscles like me ;)

Every time I dance I offer happiness and joyfull moments to my audience. Every time I teach, I offer to my students the best of my knowledges so they can evolve and have fun of course!


Comment je vais réussir? How will I succeed?

J'ai remporté un prix à toutes les compétitions auxquelles j'ai participé, c’est-à-dire une dizaine. Chaque fois, je me suis démarquée par mon charisme, mon élégance et plus récemment, par mon côté sauvage et énergique! 

Pour atteindre mon but, je travaille énormément aux niveaux de ma nutrition et de mon entraînement en force et en souplesse. De plus, je pratique quotidiennement, je suis un coaching privé en danse, je fais du yoga, etc.

*English* 

I won a prize for every competition I have done in the past. I have my own character: graceful, elegant and crazy in some points!

I do work a lot everyday to reach my goal: nutrition, training, yoga, coaching...


D'autres façons d'aider - Other way to help

Si, pour une quelconque raison, tu ne peux pas contribuer financièrement à mon rêve, tu peux tout de même passer le mot en diffusant ce projet!

Partager, mes amis, c'est ça le secret! 

Merci beaucoup et continuez à danser et à rêver!

Donya xx

*English*

You don't have a lot of money? Don't worry because you can help me and spread my project trough your friends!

Thank you very much and keep dancing and dreaming! 

Donya xx

story:
This is us...

Ophelia's Jump Productions was founded by artists and educators who believe that the purpose of theatre is to create unending conversations, spark imagination,  incite conscience, and elicit a visceral response. We aim to invigorate the creativity and intellect of our community by working with local emerging artists to do just that. OJP believes strongly in the communal power of great stories, dramatic ideas and the sincere engagement that audiences find in these theatrical events. 

At OJP, we also believe that theatre can teach young people to empathize with others, think critically, and problem solve creatively. To us, drama is literature on its feet. Theatre uniquely combines every other art form (i.e. music, conceptual art, movement, visual art, dance, sound, etc.). We want to cultivate our community's cultural landscape by opening access  for youth to interactions with theatre as audience members, participants, and dare we even say it... critics.

Long story short: We like to create.

Let us explain...

During the past three years, we've brought the Claremont area some really great theatre. 

Some (but not all) of the shows that we've produced: August: Osage County by Tracy Letts, [title of show]  by Jeff Bowen & Hunter Bell, Time Stands Still by Donald Margulies, Clybourne Park by Bruce Norris, The Goat or Who is Sylvia? by Edward Albee, A Boston Marriage by David Mamet, Eurydice by Sarah Ruhl, 33 Variations by Moisés Kaufman, Ruthless!: The Musical by Martin Laird & Joel Paley, Titus Andronicus by William Shakespeare

These were all really great productions, but in order to put them on without a permanent home, we have had to bounce around A LOT... To nine different venues.

The logistics and resources necessary to put up and tear down an entire show at a different site every time, as well as struggling to find spaces to rehearse makes it difficult to put on the high quality shows you've come to expect from us.

So here's what we're asking...

This is our 2016 season:

  • Vanya & Sonya & Masha & Spike by Christopher Durang
  • Tribes by Nina Raine
  • Othello by William Shakespeare
  • A Midsummer Night's Dream by William Shakespeare
  • The Violet Hour  by Richard Greenberg
It's ready to go along with specialized workshops for both adults and kids, themed cabaret nights, improv, and staged readings of original works. But in order to make it all happen, we need a home of our own to do it all in!

Your funding through this site will help us get our ideal starting space: a blackbox theatre with seating for 50-60 here in the Claremont area. It would also help us continue to pay our crew and actors, build our stage, and get us the equipment we need to run.

Essentially, it breaks down to about $24k for a year of rent, $4k for building materials, and $2k for used sound and light equipment. This also buys us time to grow up a little and reach our 5 year mark when we will become eligible for many grants that will help us continue!

How you can help...

  1. Money is great! Your donations to us here on IndieGoGo are tax deductible! Ophelia's Jump is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. So karma will be swift and arrive in the form of an easier tax season!
  2. Donate equipment! Do you have functional lighting or sound equipment? We're always on the lookout for light boards, dimmers, speakers, amps or additional LED's. E-mail us at info@opheliasjump.org if you do!
  3. Donate your time! If you're a building contractor, lighting or scenic designer, sound engineer, happy-go-lucky grant writer, or you just like to lift heavy stuff, we can use your help! E-mail us at info@opheliasjump.org for opportunities!
  4. Spread the word about this campaign! Even if you can't donate right now, word of mouth is a fantastic gift to give us!

story:
SOMEWHERE BETWEEN is an autobiographical solo show written and performed by Cidny Bullens. Directed by Tanya Taylor Rubinstein, the show is a multimedia theatrical production with live performances, by Cidny, of songs past and present.

SOMEWHERE BETWEEN begins with Cindy’s arrival in Los Angeles in the mid-1970’s, taking us through her fateful meetings with Bob Crewe and Elton John—brushing ever so close to stardom—and covers her unlikely journey as a wife and mother, then as a bereaved parent, and finally as a grandparent. We learn throughout the story about Cindy’s private struggle with gender identity and how, finally, she decides to jump headlong into the fire of gender transition—to become Cidny, the person he always felt he was.

Cidny Bullens’ SOMEWHERE BETWEEN is a personal, poignant and powerful story of perseverance, tragedy, triumph—and ultimately unconditional love. With a unique perspective on life, Cidny tells h/is story in an intimate setting with a guitar, images, and a healthy sense of humor.

Funds raised will go towards covering:

• Director fee

• Hiring of a multimedia firm to design and produce multimedia aspect of show

• Rentals and/or purchases of multi media, lighting & sound equipment

• Lighting, sound and set design fees

• Technical support for shows

• Rental of theatres and performance spaces

• Advertising, promotion & publicity

• Design of logo, poster and all advertising printed materials

• Travel expenses for me to drive to NM and beyond (with guitars, tech equipment, etc)

story:
Freaky Funding

Intrinsick is built on using human’s greatest addictions and the process of what might happen if these dependencies were taken away.  It has resemblances to solitary confinement reactions, but what you will discover most is that with your numbness prohibited, your real self emerges.  Restraint or lack thereof.  Inner whispers. Guilt. Abandon. Helplessness. Judgement. Manipulation. Deception. Intrinsick will leave you out of breath and searching…for…


I am Alex Floyd, the founder, artistic director, and choreographer of OdDancity, a modern dance performance company based in Los Angeles and creating unique work since 2012. Since 2013 I have been conceptualizing and researching for Intrinsick. It is a deeply intense, internal, and relatable piece which shows what may be living inside each of our human souls. It is a large representation of the seemingly small addictions and releases we NEED as humans. It is the monster inside of all of us. 


I have been choreographing since a very young age. I started my own company as soon as I could out of University after receiving a BFA in Dance Performance. Immediately I began to create and do not plan on stopping in this lifetime as choreography is what propels my life.


Funding Will FUND


1. Rehearsal and Performance Space

2. The Incredibly talented and scary dancers

3. Compensation for our designers of lighting and original music

4. Spreading the word


The Impact

The dancers of OdDancity have been working hard on this creation for over a year and I have contracted four dancers for the final project's premier in May.  They dedicate endless hours every week to the project, and I want to be able to reward their talents.

Your contributions will allow us to have a show in a perfectly scary space in downtown Los Angeles which the company has agreed upon as a useful to the theme stage. 

With donations, you can help to create one of the world's first psychological dance thrillers!! 

And even if you don't have the monetary means to donate, feel free to share our information and get people excited and obviously, COME SEE OUR SHOW!!!!

story:
The Show!

The video above is a cheeky little introduction to our delightful band 'Hearts of Folk who are the center point of this show.

'Hearts of Folk' is a brand new black comedy which shamelessly parodies all things folksy. A murder mystery in reverse jam packed with farce, satire and cornflakes, it is poised to make a splash with it's debut at the 2015 Edinburgh Fringe!
 
'Hearts of Folk', a jaded and slightly over the hill folk band, are plodding along with their UK tour, but there is a mysterious weight of bad feeling that hangs over the band like a bad smell. (There is also the issue of the actual bad smell and desperate need to stop anyone opening that one particular instrument case). The arrival of new session musician Theo brings unwanted questions, like what exactly did happen to Barry, and hidden secrets that just can't be kept any longer. 

Hopefully this sounds enticing enough to be something that you want to get involved with and lend some support to. As a team we are incredibly excited to be working together on this and believe it is a great opportunity. But who are we? Well...

The Team!

TalkSimple Productions, as well as producing a brand new show, is also starting up as a brand new company entirely in its own right. Made up almost exclusively of recent graduates from the University of York, the team has worked together on a number of student projects and between them have run a major performance society at the university for a year.

'Hearts of Folk' is their first professional venture together hopefully, with your backing, the first of many. Following a successful preview in York they are confident of a good reception in Edinburgh.
TalkSimple Team:
  • Producer: Simon Lewis                                    Arts Designer: Liam Major
  • Director: Katie Wilkinson                                 Marketing Assistant: Shahreen Vacha
  • Writers: Tom Keefe and Lucy Walters        Cast: Edd Riley, Megan Conway, Mary
  • Assistant Producer: Katie Harrison             O'Connell, Tom Cocker and Guy
  • Marketing Director: Laura Stratford            Matthews


Your Money!

So, how will what you generously donate help us make 'Hearts of Folk' as good as it possibly can be? The breakdown of our major costs are as follows:

Venue Hire - £2600. We are performing at the very aptly named Paradise in the                                   Vault and this is the cost of hiring their theatre for the full run of the                                 Fringe between the 8th and 31st of August. There is no better place                                 than the Fringe for theatre so the longer we can be there the better!

Instruments/Cases - £200. No good, or indeed terrible band, can function without                                              these and the more the merrier! Sadly they don't come cheap                                            and we need your help to ensure Hearts of Folk are as kitted                                                out as possible!

Transport- £200. All those instruments that we need also need to get up to                                        Edinburgh and then back home again at the end, this means hiring vans                        and driving plenty!

Anything that you can give would be massively appreciated. It would help make this excellent show a reality and, better than that alone, a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel able to donate anything at this moment in time, but do think that this project sounds like something worth getting behind and supporting, then please please do share it with your friends via any method of social media you have access to or indeed that old fashioned way of word of mouth! Anything you can do to show us a little bit of love would be amazing and would genuinely mean the world to everyone involved. 

Thank you so much in advance, we are truly grateful.

Have a fabulous day and all the very best,

Love from the Hearts of Folk team!

story:
VERGE THEATER COMPANY
  • Producing stimulating, affordable theater for Nashville.
  • Providing opportunities for theater artists to express themselves, especially young women.
  • Bringing small budget, topical, raw, representative, risky, Chicago-style theater to Nashville.

We were the Five Dollar Recession Theater Company but it's time to grow. The recession may be over but the need for affordable theater, opportunities for young artists, expanding the theater audience, and reflecting the changing demographic of Nashville is here. It's your chance to help instill theater into this vibrant city in a powerful and lasting way.

Pricing: Tickets will be free to high school students, $10 if you are in college, $20 if you're in your twenties and $30 if you are in your thirties and above. Anything you can pay above that will be appreciated. Artists will always pay a sliding scale.

Plays: Verge will operate without dogma. There is not one "kind" of play we will produce besides good. Ambiguous, I know. Good can mean experimental or entertaining. Whatever catches our fancy. Trust us. It will be something people will enjoy.

 Budget: We want to budget $6,000-$7,000 per show. This will pay for the rights to the play, designers and director fees, and actor stipends. (Actors will also receive a small percentage of profits from the door.) We need to fund a website and a ticket sales platform too. Whew. Once the initial seed money is invested our ticket sales will become the producing funds. We aim to be self sufficient within two years.
  • Our 501 (c)3 status is pending and your donation will be tax deductable
  • Our perks are personal, fun, and won't take up a lot of space
  • If we only make $5,000 with this campaign we will STILL put on a play. Your money will be put to good use. We promise.
 Other Ways You Can Help: SPREAD THE WORD! We know some can spare $1, some can donate $50 but if everyone shared this plea on FB, Twitter, etc. we would make our goal (or more) in no time.
THANK YOU!
Verge Theater Company

story:
“Let the Sky Rain Potatoes!”
-Falstaff, The Merry Wives of Windsor
Pigpal, welcome! 
We are so glad you made it to our fundraising page for Hedgepig's The Merry Wives of Windsor. We've created the spud-tastic Merry Tots of Tatertown to help us track our success and bring you a laugh or two along the way. 
We reached our 1st milestone so we released episode 2! (Episode 1 found in our gallery). When we reach $3000, we'll release episode 3!
All donations go toward our summer production of The Merry Wives of Windsor. Learn more about our (real-life) Merry Wives production below!

Much Love,

The Hedgepigs 
Mary Candler & Gwendolyn Kelso, co-Artistic Directors
Emily Lyon, Nico Ager, Michael Amendola & Andrew Hutcheson, ensemble
---

Hedgepig Ensemble Theatre is thrilled to announce its upcoming production!

The Merry Wives of Windsor
By William Shakespeare
Directed by Paul Nicholas
August 20 – 29, 2015
The Treehouse Theatre, New York City

Why Merry Wives, you ask?

Hedgepigs are unique and playful creatures that deliver the unexpected, just like our ensemble. We believe that Merry Wives is a piece that awakens the human spirit through the joy and humor of two strong women and an ensemble of unique characters. The language, of course, is delightfully delicious to boot. It’s a perfect fit for our mission and ensemble.

This will be our largest undertaking to date. Eleven actors. Six weeks of rehearsal. Two weeks of performance. A set. Costumes. And Props—one buck basket, in particular.

This is where we need you!

The Merry Wives of Windsor will cost $7,500 to mount, thus The Merry Tots of Tatertown were born. As you help us raise money, certain benchmarks will unlock new versions of Tatertown. As you help us progress this savory story, you'll also be helping us build our real-life production ofThe Merry Wives of Windsor!

There are a number of giving levels, but please remember that gifts of ALL SIZES make a substantial difference. 

Mission
Hedgepig is an enthusiastic ambassador of storytelling. Through ensemble-based classical work, we strive to liberate the human spirit and awaken empathy.

Values
Hedgepig strives to give women a meaningful voice in classic theater by offering leadership roles, choosing plays that feature women, and examining the work of lesser known female classical playwrights. 

Hedgepig believes that a well-trained ensemble that works together, trains together, and plays together is the key to making powerful theatre.


Thank you so much for your support!
